Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.sort.helper

Interface Instrument

All Known Subinterfaces:
ComparableHelper<X>, Helper<X>, NonComparableHelper<X>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseComparableHelper, BaseComparatorHelper, ClassicHelper, InstrumentedComparableHelper, InstrumentedComparatorHelper, Instrumenter, InstrumenterDummy, NonInstrumentingComparableHelper
public interface Instrument
Interface to define the operations of instrumentation.

  • Field Details

    • SWAPS

      static final String SWAPS
      In the swap operation, two elements of the same array are exchanged. There will never be any lookups incurred, but there may be hits (usually, there are). A swap fixes some number (one or more) of inversions.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • COMPARES

      static final String COMPARES
      A compare operation compares two values, either (or both) of which may be the result of a hit. Additionally, either value may incur a lookup (unless it is a primitive value). In such cases, there may be additional lookups required, but we don't attempt to count those here.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • COPIES

      static final String COPIES
      A copy is just what it sounds like. The copying of an element from one array to another. Some swaps involve copying, but we don't currently track such swaps.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INVERSIONS

      static final String INVERSIONS
      An inversion is the property of an input array: whereby two elements are out of order. The usual convention is that the smaller element of a pair should be on the left.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • FIXES

      static final String FIXES
      A fix is a single inversion that is no longer inverted. A swap may fix one or more inversions.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • HITS

      static final String HITS
      A hit is the approximation of an (amortized) cache page fault when accessing an array element. The larger the array and the smaller the cache, the more likely a random array access will cause a page fault. But we can't really take account of all that in this program, so we just keep track of every time an array element is accessed.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • LOOKUPS

      static final String LOOKUPS
      A lookup is the approximation of an (amortized) cache page fault when accessing an object on the heap. A lookup is much more likely to incur a cache page fault than an array access (especially if the array is accessed sequentially). Thus hits and lookups both contribute to the overall time of an algorithm but it is to be expected that a lookup requires more time on average than a hit. A lookup will typically occur only for a comparison or for a classification.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • INSTRUMENTING

      static final String INSTRUMENTING
      A constant string indicating that the system is currently in an instrumenting mode.

      The "instrumenting" state typically refers to a mode in which performance metrics or operational statistics, such as swaps, comparisons, or fixes, are tracked and recorded.

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SHOW_STATS

      static final String SHOW_STATS
      A constant used to represent the key or identifier for enabling or displaying statistical data related to performance metrics. This variable is typically used to determine whether the statistics, such as swaps, comparisons, copies, and others, should be shown or processed within the context of the instrument's operations.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • init

      void init(int n, int nRuns)
      Initializes the instrument with the specified number of elements and runs.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of elements to initialize
      nRuns - the number of runs to perform

    • getStatPack

      StatPack getStatPack()
      Retrieves the StatPack instance containing statistical data.
      Returns:
      a StatPack object encapsulating various statistics such as swaps, compares, copies, and other tracked metrics.

    • getCompares

      long getCompares()
      Retrieves the number of compare operations performed.
      Returns:
      the total number of compare operations as a long value

    • getSwaps

      long getSwaps()
      Retrieves the total number of swap operations recorded.
      Returns:
      The total count of swaps performed.

    • getFixes

      long getFixes()
      Returns the total count of "fixes" that have been recorded. A "fix" typically represents a specific corrective action or operation counted during the execution of a process.
      Returns:
      the total number of fixes.

    • getHits

      long getHits()
      Retrieves the current count of "hits" recorded by the instrument.
      Returns:
      the total number of hits as a long value

    • getLookups

      long getLookups()
      Retrieves the total number of lookup operations recorded.
      Returns:
      the number of lookups as a long value

    • getCopies

      long getCopies()
      Retrieves the number of copies performed by the instrument.
      Returns:
      the total number of copies as a long value.

    • incrementCopies

      void incrementCopies(int n)
      Increments the count of copies by the specified value.
      Parameters:
      n - the number by which to increase the copy count

    • incrementHits

      void incrementHits(long n)
      Increments the hit count by a specified value.
      Parameters:
      n - the number by which to increase the hit count

    • incrementLookups

      void incrementLookups()
      Increments the count of lookups performed by the instrument. This method is used to track the number of lookup operations in the context of performance measurement or algorithm analysis.

    • incrementFixes

      void incrementFixes(int n)
      Increments the count of fixes by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of fixes to increment; must be a positive integer

    • incrementCompares

      void incrementCompares()
      Increments the count of comparison operations performed during the execution of an algorithm or process. This method is used for tracking and recording the number of comparisons made, which can be helpful for performance measurement and analysis.

    • incrementSwaps

      void incrementSwaps(int n)
      Increments the swap count by the specified value.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of swaps to increment; must be a positive integer

    • countFixes

      boolean countFixes()
      Determines whether the system should count the number of fixes during its operation.
      Returns:
      true if counting fixes is enabled, otherwise false

    • gatherStatistic

      void gatherStatistic()
      Collects and records statistical data related to various operations such as swaps, comparisons, copies, inversions, fixes, hits, and lookups. This method is typically used to aggregate and store the current metrics for later analysis or reporting.

    • isShowStats

      boolean isShowStats()
      Determines if statistics should be shown.
      Returns:
      true if statistics are enabled to be displayed; false otherwise.
